intro: Artanthe casapiensis, commonly known as the Casapiensis artanthe, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, forming dense clusters that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
